member.name: T:Capptain.Agent.CapptainInternalAgent
member.summary: The Capptain Agent module allows you to report your application statistics. The Capptain Agent must be initialized by calling the "Init(string, string [...])" method.

member.name: F:Capptain.Agent.CapptainInternalAgent.sService
member.summary: Service.

member.name: F:Capptain.Agent.CapptainInternalAgent.sPendingCommands
member.summary: A list that stores all the commands that has been called before the service instanciation. When the service is ready, we replay these commands.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.CapptainInternalAgent.Init(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Init the Capptain Agent module. You should call this method when your application starts.
member.exception: * If called twice. * If incorrect Application Id. * If incorrect SDK Key.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.CapptainInternalAgent.SetPlatformProvider
member.summary: Set the plaftorm provider instance with the one available. This method is a terrible hack, but I'm unable to find a better way currently (it's not possible to have a partial class between differents assemblies).

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.CapptainInternalAgent.StartCommand(System.Action)
member.summary: Start a command. If the module is not created/started, defer the command.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.CapptainInternalAgent.Check(System.Action)
member.summary: Execute a command and catch exceptions.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.CapptainInternalAgent.Terminate
member.summary: Manually terminate the Capptain Agent.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.CapptainInternalAgent.StartActivity(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Object,System.Object})
member.summary: Notify the start of a new activity within the current session. A session being a sequence of activities, this call sets the current activity within the current session. If there is no current session, this call starts a new session.
member.param: The name of the current activity for the current session, can be null for default name (but cannot be empty). Name is limited to 64 characters.

The extra details associated with the activity. Keys must match the ^[a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z_0-9]* regular expression. Extras are encoded into JSON before being sent to the server, the encoded limit is 1024 characters.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.CapptainInternalAgent.EndActivity
member.summary: Report that the current activity ended. This will close the session.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.CapptainInternalAgent.StartJob(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Object,System.Object})
member.summary: Notify the start of a new job.
member.param: Unique job name, two jobs with the same name can't run at the same time, if a job is started twice, the second version of the job will replace the first one. Name is limited to 64 characters and cannot be empty.

The extra details associated with this job (can be null). Keys must match the ^[a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z_0-9]* regular expression. Extras are encoded into JSON before being sent to the server, the encoded limit is 1024 characters.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.CapptainInternalAgent.EndJob(System.String)
member.summary: Notify the end of a job. This has no effect if no job is running for the specified name.
member.param: The name of a job that has been started with "StartJob(string, Dictionnary)"

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.CapptainInternalAgent.SendEvent(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Object,System.Object})
member.summary: Send an event unrelated to any session or job.
member.param: Name event name/tag. Name is limited to 64 characters and cannot be empty.

The extra details associated with this event (can be null). Keys must match the ^[a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z_0-9]* regular expression. Extras are encoded into JSON before being sent to the server, the encoded limit is 1024 characters.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.CapptainInternalAgent.SendSessionEvent(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Object,System.Object})
member.summary: Send an event related to the current session. This has no effect if the session has not been started.
member.param: Event name/tag. Name is limited to 64 characters and cannot be empty.

The extra details associated with this event (can be null). Keys must match the ^[a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z_0-9]* regular expression. Extras are encoded into JSON before being sent to the server, the encoded limit is 1024 characters.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.CapptainInternalAgent.SendJobEvent(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Object,System.Object})
member.summary: Send an event related to a running job. This has no effect if no job is running for the specified name.
member.param: Event name/tag. Name is limited to 64 characters and cannot be empty.

The extra details associated with this event (can be null). Keys must match the ^[a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z_0-9]* regular expression. Extras are encoded into JSON before being sent to the server, the encoded limit is 1024 characters.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.CapptainInternalAgent.SendError(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Object,System.Object})
member.summary: Send an error unrelated to any session or job.
member.param: Error name/tag. Name is limited to 64 characters and cannot be empty.

The extra details associated with this error (can be null). Keys must match the ^[a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z_0-9]* regular expression. Extras are encoded into JSON before being sent to the server, the encoded limit is 1024 characters.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.CapptainInternalAgent.SendSessionError(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Object,System.Object})
member.summary: Send an error related to the current session. This has no effect if the session has not been started.
member.param: Error name/tag. Name is limited to 64 characters and cannot be empty.

The extra details associated with this error (can be null) Keys must match the ^[a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z_0-9]* regular expression. Extras are encoded into JSON before being sent to the server, the encoded limit is 1024 characters.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.CapptainInternalAgent.SendJobError(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Object,System.Object})
member.summary: Send an error related to a running job. This has no effect if no job is running for the specified name.
member.param: Error name/tag. Name is limited to 64 characters and cannot be empty.

The extra details associated with this error (can be null). Keys must match the ^[a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z_0-9]* regular expression. Extras are encoded into JSON before being sent to the server, the encoded limit is 1024 characters.

member.summary: Send application specific informations.
member.param: Application information as a Dictionary. Keys must match the ^[a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z_0-9]* regular expression. Extras are encoded into JSON before being sent to the server, the encoded limit is 1024 characters.

member.summary: Get the device identifier.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.CapptainInternalAgent.SetBurstThreshold(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Set the delay between each request to the capptain back-end. By default, the value is 0, which means that the requests are sent in real-time. If you provide a value greather than 0, the logs will be bundled and send at the given value interval. The value must be higher than 1000ms in order to be effective. Otherwise, the burst threshold will be reset to real-time (0).
If you want to reset the burst threshold, simply pass 0 to the method.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.CapptainService.GetInitialMethodInException(System.Exception)
member.summary:
Get the method that causes the exception.
Eg.:
System.NullReferenceException: You have reached the border of the galaxy at MetroPuppet.Views.PuppetView2.Button_Tap_1(Object sender, GestureEventArgs e) at MS.Internal.CoreInvokeHandler.InvokeEventHandler(Int32 typeIndex, Delegate handlerDelegate, Object sender, Object args) at MS.Internal.JoltHelper.FireEvent(IntPtr unmanagedObj, IntPtr unmanagedObjArgs, Int32 argsTypeIndex, Int32 actualArgsTypeIndex, String eventName)
Returns :
$ -> "MetroPuppet.Views.PuppetView2.Button_Tap_1(Object sender, GestureEventArgs e)"

member.summary: Compare two dictionaries for strict equality.
member.returns: True if strictly equal. False otherwise.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.CapptainService.OnSuspended
member.summary: On suspended. Terminate the service.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.CapptainService.OnCrashed(System.Exception)
member.summary: On crashed handler. Send the crash and close the session.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.CapptainService.OnLocIdRead(System.Object,Capptain.Agent.EventArgs{System.String})
member.summary:
When the application is started, we call the /ip-to-country API to get the current location country code. However, we do not send the log directly, but when we need it. This is why we listen to the LocIdRead event from the logBuilder to know when the loc id is accessed.
When it's the case, we check if the locationIp log exists, and if the locId is not already set, we send it. Anyways, we reset the pending location IP log whatever it has been send or not.

member.summary: Create a new capptain log object

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.CapptainLog.SetAttribute(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Add an attribute to the Capptain log.
The key and value must not be null or composed of whitespaces. If an attribe has already been set, its value will be erased.
The key and value are trimmed.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.CapptainLog.SetExtras(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Object,System.Object},System.Int32)
member.summary:
Set the extras with a list of extras if the extras aren't null. CAREFUL : if the extras AND a body are set for this log, ONLY the extras are going to be converted.
The extras are validated. Reasons to be invalid : - content greater than MAX_CONTENT_SIZE characters.
Throw an CapptainInvalidLogException if invalid.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.CapptainLog.SetExtras(System.Xml.Linq.XElement)
member.summary:
Set the extras with an XElement if not null. CAREFUL : if the extras AND a body are set for this log, ONLY the extras are going to be converted.
No validation. Internal only.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.CapptainLog.RemoveExtras
member.summary: Remove all the extras.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.CapptainLog.SetBody(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Object,System.Object},System.Int32)
member.summary:
Set the body if the dictionary is not empty. If the body has been set before, erase it.
CAREFUL : if the extras AND a body are set for this log, ONLY the extras are going to be converted.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.CapptainLog.SetBody(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Set the body if the date is not null/whitespaces. If a body has been set before, erase it.
CAREFUL : if the extras AND a body are set for this log, ONLY the extras are going to be converted.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.CapptainLog.RemoveBody
member.summary: Remove the body.

member.summary: Validate that a data is limited to a given size. If the limit is lesser or equal to 0, do nothing.
member.exception: The exception thrown if the body is greater than the limit.

member.summary: Create a copy of the logs awaiting in the spool.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.Spool.Delete(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Delete a certain number of logs from the spool and the storage. Delete the old ones first.
For example, if :
[0: "Sparrow", 1: "Obvious", 2: "Flam"]
Delete(2) will let :
[0: "Flam"]
If the range is greater or equal than the number of logs, we simply delete the whole list.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.Spool.Clear
member.summary: Delete all logs from the spool and storage.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.Spool.IsEmpty
member.summary: Spool emptiness.
member.returns: True if the spool is empty, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.HttpClient.CreateQueryString(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Create a quiry string for a uri and a list of parameters
member.returns:
A query string.
For example, if you call :
$ CreateQueryString("http://example.com/api", { "value": "test", "info" : "42" });
You get :
$ "http://example.com/api?value=test&info=42"

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.HttpClient.CreateQueryString(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Create a query string for a list of parameters
member.returns:
A query string.
For example, if you call :
$ CreateQueryString({ "value": "test", "info" : "42" });
You get :
$ "?value=test&info=42"

member.summary: The capptain backend set a cookie containing a string used by the authentification. We must store it globally to give it to the authenticated request.

member.summary: Limit the number of digest attempts to one.

member.summary: Enable or disable digest process

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.DigestHttpClient.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initialize the digest authentication client with a username and password.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.DigestHttpClient.Post(System.String,System.String,System.Action{System.String,System.Nullable{System.Net.HttpStatusCode}},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a post request and send it instantly
member.param: The callback to manage the result

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.DigestHttpClient.Send(System.Net.HttpWebRequest,System.Action{System.String,System.Nullable{System.Net.HttpStatusCode}})
member.summary: Send an http request

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.DigestHttpClient.SendSync(System.Net.HttpWebRequest,System.String)
member.summary:
Send a request synchronously, without waiting for a response. The body will be set on the same thread and no callback will be executed when the request will end.
This allows us to have a request that will not block the fast-switching feature of Windows Phone when returning on the app.
CAREFUL : the digest auth will not processed when using this method. Indeed, we do not wait for a response. That means that we cannot know if the request succeeds. However, if the digest auth has been processed before this request, we will use the cookie container and it should work correctly.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.DigestHttpClient.HandleResponse(System.Net.HttpWebResponse,System.Action{System.String,System.Nullable{System.Net.HttpStatusCode}})
member.summary: Handle the response, and invoke the callback depending on the result.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.DigestHttpClient.HandleDigest(System.Net.WebException,System.Net.HttpWebRequest,System.String,System.Action{System.String,System.Nullable{System.Net.HttpStatusCode}})
member.summary: Handle the digest processing.
member.param: The web exception from the previous request

member.summary: Default epoch value.

member.summary: Default value for the burst threshold.

member.summary: Request time out.

member.name: F:Capptain.Agent.CapptainHttpService.sBurstThreshold
member.summary: Delay between each request to the http logger. In milliseconds.

member.name: F:Capptain.Agent.CapptainHttpService.mEpoch
member.summary:
The epoch is a capptain referential sent at the beginning of the HTTP session. Each subsequent log will refer its creation time to this time.
By default, or when the epoch is invalid, we set its value to long.MaxValue.

member.name: F:Capptain.Agent.CapptainHttpService.mCancellationTokenSource
member.summary: Task cancellation token.

member.name: F:Capptain.Agent.CapptainHttpService.mTaskHandler
member.summary: Task synchronization.

member.name: F:Capptain.Agent.CapptainHttpService.mRetryHandler
member.summary: Retry handling.

member.name: F:Capptain.Agent.CapptainHttpService.mIsDisabledInHardMode
member.summary:
Indicate if the application has been disabled by the backend (in hard mode). An application can be : - activated - disabled (soft mode) - disabled (hard mode)
When an application is disabled in hard mode, no logs are stored and nothing is send at all.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.CapptainHttpService.Open
member.summary: Open the service.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.CapptainHttpService.Close
member.summary: Close the service.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.CapptainHttpService.Run
member.summary:
Service task.
Two steps : - if the epoch is invalid, sent it - otherwise, send the bundle, either in burst mode or in real-time

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.CapptainHttpService.SendLog(Capptain.Agent.CapptainLog)
member.summary: Tell to the service to send a new log.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.CapptainHttpService.SendLastBatch(System.Collections.Generic.List{Capptain.Agent.CapptainLog})
member.summary: Add some logs to the spool, and try to send them, without waiting for a response. Use this method when the application is about to close. Because we do not wait for the response, the UI Thread will not be blocked if the application is reactivated. The tradeoff is that the logs won't be cleaned from the spool, even if they reach the back-end. So we will re-send them when the application will be restarted. The back-end will delete them if it had already received the logs previously.
member.param: Logs to send (generally, endJob, endSession and an eventual crash)

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.CapptainHttpService.SendEpoch
member.summary: Send the epoch.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.CapptainHttpService.SendBundle
member.summary: Send a bundle (list of logs).

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.CapptainHttpService.Send(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Send data to the capptain backend via http.
member.param: Does the http client will be allowed to forward http 401 unauthorized response
member.returns: Return the http status code of the http request. If the request has been sent correctly, the exact status code will be returned. Otherwise, return a Request Timeout code (the request must be done in TIMEOUT seconds, otherwise, we will terminate it).

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.CapptainHttpService.HandleError(System.Nullable{System.Net.HttpStatusCode},System.Collections.Generic.List{Capptain.Agent.CapptainLog})
member.summary: Handle exceptionnal cases for a request, at a Capptain level (to change the state of the service, not to manage HTTP request). - Authentification error - Invalid app - Disabled app (soft or hard mode)
member.param: Logs sent or tried to be sent.

member.name: T:Capptain.Agent.Logger
member.summary: Simple log wrapper

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.Logger.Debug(System.String,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary:
Display a trace for debugging.
Example :
Debug("[Capptain]", "trace"); $ "[Capptain] trace."
Debug("[Capptain]", "trace", "more trace"); $ "[Capptain] trace." $ "more trace"

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.Logger.Info(System.String,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary:
Display an info trace. This trace is visible in release mode.
Example :
Info("[Capptain]", "trace"); $ "[Capptain] trace."

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.Logger.CreateMessage(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary:
Create a log message.
Example :
CreateMessage("[Capptain]", "log"); $ -> "[Capptain] trace."

member.name: T:Capptain.Agent.RetryHandler
member.summary: Retry handling.

member.name: F:Capptain.Agent.RetryHandler.MAX_RETRY_THRESHOLD
member.summary: Maximum time before a failed attempt and a new retry. In milliseconds : 60min (3.600.000 = 1000 * 60 * 60 = 60min)

member.name: F:Capptain.Agent.RetryHandler.BASE_RETRY_THRESHOLD
member.summary: Base time before a failed attempt and a new retry. In milliseconds : 1s (1.000 = 1000 * 1 = 1s)

member.name: F:Capptain.Agent.RetryHandler.COEFFICIENT_RETRY_THRESHOLD
member.summary: Coefficient to apply after each new attempt.

member.name: F:Capptain.Agent.RetryHandler.mAwaitHandler
member.summary: Awaiter.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.RetryHandler.#ctor
member.summary: Create a new retry handler.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.RetryHandler.Increase
member.summary: Increate the current threshold, except if it has reached its max time.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.RetryHandler.AwaitAndIncrease
member.summary: Increase the retry threshold, and pause the current thread for this time.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.RetryHandler.CancelAwait
member.summary: Resume the current thread if it has been paused.

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.RetryHandler.Reset
member.summary: Reset the retry threshold.

member.name: P:Capptain.Agent.RetryHandler.Threshold
member.summary: Retry threshold. Each time a request fails, we wait for a given time before a new attempt. This time is increased for each new attempt.

member.summary: Helper to write trace with the release configuration

member.name: M:Capptain.Agent.Trace.WriteLine(System.String)
member.summary: Write in the console. This traces are visible even with the release configuration.
